arg... no translators?! *tear* and i was planning on going cuz it's only like 2 hours away...if my parents would let me, that is...lol...oh wait..baka desu!!! Its the first day of school, nvm... *depressed and wishing japanese sounded closer to chinese* sigh...i wonder if he'll give any more new info than what was in his book...
 
~Saitohworship
*i finally got my internet back!!!! XD soooo much emails... 204 in this group alone T_T

secretary <secretarytocapt3@...> wrote:
good and BAD news...the speaker on sept 9 will be Jiro Asada who wrote
Mibugishiden...now for the bad news...no translator...S. California is
home to a huge population of Japanese Americans not to mention major
universities with Japanese language dept.  if you are upset then so am
I!!! I have PERSONALLY encouraged JAL to hire a translator for Mr.
Asada because as a native of CA I know that many anime fansubs are
from these universities.  So I was outraged that JAL would send Mr.
Asada here without a translator.  The lady on the line said that she
will speak to her superiors about getting a translator for Mr. Asada

For the S. CA (Torrance) lecture you can only pay with personal check
or money order over the phone and tickets will be mailed to you ASAP...
...furthermore there will be a second lecture again by Jiro Asada in
San Francisco on Sept 10 call (415) 765-8545 at the Palo Alto Hotel
but the focus will be more on the Bakumatsu.

--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "bsher213" <bsher213@b...> wrote:
> I just stumbled across this on a SHisnengumi LJ community I just found
> 
> 
> Shinsengumi to Sono Jidai' (Shinsengumi and Their Times)
> Sept. 9, 2004 - 7:00pm at the Torrance Marriott
> contact JAL's LA branch at (310)607-2330 for info.
> 
> I know we  have Californians out there---Someone has to go and bring
> us back information and pictures!!!
> 
> Barb Sheridan
